div.p: On behalf of our students, educators, and board of education, I welcome you to the Fairview Independent School District! In our district, we are committed to giving our students our absolute best in everything we do. This is evident in our district’s vision statement, “Eagle Pride: Every Student, Every Day.”

div.a: Read More about the superintendent's message
Updated School Closure Information due to COVID 19

a.title: Click to read more about: Updated School Closure Information due to COVID 19

div.a: Read More about Updated School Closure Information due to COVID 19

a.title: Click to read more about: Senior Spotlight

span.p: Friday, March 6th will be an Early Release Day. The Elementary School will be dismissed at 12:00 pm and the High/Middle School will be released at 12:15 pm.

We would like to congratulate the Fairview Archery team on a couple of great finishes in the past two weeks. On January 11th, the Fairview Archery Team took home a third place finish at the University of Pikeville Archery tournament. Then, they followed that up with a second place finish at the Rose Hill tournament on January 17-18. Great job goes out to our student athletes!

The 2019/20 Fairview District Calendar has been updated. Friday, December 6, 2019 will be a non-school attendance day for students to allow staff a PD day. This change will result in Friday, February 14, 2020 being changed to a student attendance day in our calendar. If you or your family has a conflict with your child being in attendance on February 14, 2020 please call Ben Coleman, Director of District Wide Programs, at Central Office, 606-324-3877 ext. 2020 by December 20, 2019 and we will work with you on your concerns.
Please review the Important Letter from Superintendent Risden-Smith.
